intro: Micranthes merkii subsp. idsuroei, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada mountain saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and hairy stems. The subspecies is distinguished by its compact growth habit and specific habitat preferences, often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine pubescence, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. This plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in rocky areas.
